intro: Taxanthema cordatum, commonly known as the heartleaf saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its succulent, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a splash of color to rocky habitats. Taxanthema cordatum is typically found growing in crevices and on rocky slopes, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in extreme desert conditions.
